sentence.text: cation transport is a Ca(2+) activated Cl(-) channel that is related to head and neck cancer, often caused by human papilloma virus (HPV) infection.

Because protein N-linked glycosylation via asparagine8 is required to lower cytosolic Zn(2+) concentrations by the Zn(2+) transporter ZnT-1, we hypothesize that HPV infections and cancer caused by mutations in TMC8 are related to upregulated Zn(2+)/Ca(2+) signaling and activation of cation transport.
